resources.string:
WaterMe is the software engineering project of three students at the cooperative states university Karlsruhe, Germany.
 
 Starting in october 2016 we planned to create a system which can measure the humidity of a plant and notify the user about when to water the plant.
 We were inspired by our own everyday life. 
 As we could not handle to water our plants and keep them alive, we knew we had to change something. 
 
 The system is based on a Raspberry Pi and sensors. In addition an application is provided to receive notifications from the Pi. 
 The sensors measure the humidity of the soil. 
 The Pi processes this data and sends it via Bluetooth to the application.
 
 Follow our progress on gtaproject.wordpress.com

Prequisite: 
 Your Smartphone has to be paired with the Pi. 
 To do so head to the Bluetooth-Menu of your Smartphone, enable Bluetooth and click on your Pi. 
 
 
 
 First enable Bluetooth: 
 
 From the main menu 
 1: Press Settings 
 2: Press the switch "Bluetooth" 
 3: Agree to the notification 
 
 
 Then the app automatically connects to the PIí when you are trying to perfom an action which reuqires bluetooth-connection.

To add an additional plant 
 
 From the main menu 
 1: Press MyPlants 
 2: Press the + in the top-right corner 
 3: Choose an image 
 4: Enter the name of your plant 
 5: Press OK 
 
 
 To delete a plant: 
 
 In the MyPlants menu: 
 1: Press the trashcan next to the plant
